CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-3 - Length of pre-trial detention)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and is detained in PERSON , PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of drug dealing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Samara remanded the applicant in custody . The court held that the applicant was suspected of a serious crime , that he could abscond , commit crimes , destroy evidence , threaten witnesses or in any other way interfere with the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the applicant ’s pre - trial detention . The court reproduced the reasoning of the previous detention order . The court also indicated that the applicant had played a leading part in the criminal activities .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the applicant ’s pretrial detention on the ground that the investigation was still pending and it was necessary to conduct some investigative activities . The court further referred to the same grounds as in the previous detention orders .
CARDINAL . ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeals against the detention orders .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE convicted the applicant of drug trafficking and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment and a fine . On DATE ORG upheld his conviction on appeal .
